page.title: 16THE ANNUAL FLOOD
page.content: IN WINTER WHEN THE WATER LEVEL IN THE RIVER DON ROSE SOME YEARS THE RIVER BURST ITS BANKS AND A LARGE PART OF THE VILLAGE WAS FLOODED. MOST OF THE HOUSES, SHOPS, FARMS AND PUBS HAD THEIR GROUND FLOOR FLOODED. IN THE HOUSES PEOPLE HAD TO TAKE ALL THEIR BELONGINGS UP STAIRS EVEN THE CARPETS, CURTAINS AND THEIR RADIOS AND EVERYTHING IN THE HOUSE. THEY HAD TO TAKE EVERYTHING IN THE SHOPS UPSTAIRS AND EVERYTHING UPSTAIRS IN THE PUBS AND THEY SOMETIMES TOOK A FEW ANIMALS FROM THE FARMHOUSE UPSTAIRS. WHEN WATER CAME INTO THE HOUSES, PUBS AND SHOPS AND FARMS IT LEFT A REALLY TERRIBLE SMELL WHEN THE WATER HAD DISAPPEARED. THEY HAD WOODEN PLANKS STANDING ON BEER BARRELS TO MAKE WALKWAYS. THE POSTMAN CAME ALONG IN A ROWING BOAT TO DELIVER LETTERS AND MEN BROUGHT GROCERIES TO THEIR DOORS. THEY
